thread.title: H.S. football: Offensive Player of the Year Watch
thread.title_full: H.S. football: Offensive Player of the Year Watch

title: H.S. football: Offensive Player of the Year Watch
text:
H.S. football: Offensive Player of the Year Watch October 26, 2015 Last updated: Monday, October 26, 2015, 1:21 AM The Record 
Offensive Player of the Year watch 
Joan Andujar, Weehawken, sr. RB 
Went over 200 rushing yards for a second straight game with a 42-carry, 228-yard, three-TD performance in the Indians’ 20-19 victory over Secaucus. Improved season totals to 1,121 yards and 15 TDs on 194 attempts through seven games. 
Peter Guerriero, Lyndhurst, sr. QB 
Gained 181 yards on only five carries and rushed for two TDs in 1 1/2 quarters of action during a 47-7 win over Montclair Immaculate. Has rushed 136 times for 1,575 yards and 18 TDs in seven games. 
Kevin Kosakowski, Rutherford, sr. RB 
Ran 27 times for 154 yards and two TDs in addition to catching three passes for 63 yards in a 27-6 victory over Garfield. In six games, has 672 rushing yards and 13 TDs on 84 carries, as well as 13 catches for 262 yards and a TD. 
Tim O’Brien, Indian Hills, sr. QB 
Completed 12 of 17 passes for 232 yards and five TDs in the Braves’ 49-10 defeat of Tenafly. Has connected on 67 percent of his passes for 1,654 yards and 24 TDs and just four interceptions in seven games. 
Derius Stone, St. Mary, sr. RB 
Another tremendous performance (19 carries, 307 yards, four TDs) in a 42-6 victory over Bogota placed Stone on pace to run for at least 2,329 yards and 36 TDs. Season totals are 166 carries for 1,630 yards and 25 TDs through seven games. 
— Mark J. Czerwinski and Keith Idec
